BP.term: negative regulation of membrane protein ectodomain proteolysis

interpro.desc: Tissue inhibitor of metalloproteinase, conserved site

name: TIMP metallopeptidase inhibitor 4
summary: This gene belongs to the TIMP gene family. The proteins encoded by this gene family are inhibitors of the matrix metalloproteinases, a group of peptidases involved in degradation of the extracellular matrix. The secreted, netrin domain-containing protein encoded by this gene is involved in regulation of platelet aggregation and recruitment and may play role in hormonal regulation and endometrial tissue remodeling. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
